title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 22.4 - Contents of certificate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 22.4 - Contents of certificate

State Regulations
(a) The
contents of the certificate of literacy shall be as follows: (1)
the full name of the applicant, written
in ink by the applicant in the presence of the examiner; (2)
the printed, stamped or written signature
of the commissioner; (3)
the date
of issuance of the certificate; and
(4)
the full name and position of the
examiner, written by examiner. (b) Where the certificate is issued by the
superintendent of schools, the certificate shall also contain: (1)
name of city, village or town where
certificate is issued; and
(2)
printed, stamped or written signature of the superintendent of schools in whose
district the certificate of literacy is issued. (c) Where the certificate is issued by the
central registration board, the certificate shall also contain: (1)
name of county where the certificate of
literacy is issued; and
(2)
written
signatures of all members of the central registration board issuing the
certificate of literacy. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
22.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
